title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 701.2 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 701.2 - Definitions

State Regulations

Whenever used in this Part: (a) Commissioner means the Commissioner of

Labor of the State of New York. (b) Hearing officer means the person authorized or designated by the commissioner
to conduct a hearing. (c) Department means the Department of Labor of the State of New York. (d) Ruling means a determination or order
issued by the commissioner in a particular case or group of cases. (e) Adjudicatory proceeding means a
proceeding before the Department in which a determination of legal rights, duties or privileges of named parties thereto is required by law to be made
only on a record and after an opportunity for a formal adversarial
hearing. Notes

701.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
